summary.p: This 1958 collection of Sanskrit stories by Hemarāja Śāstrī contains an abbreviated version of story 11 from the Vikramacarita. The story is followed by a Sanskrit-Hindi glossary and a list of reading comprehension questions. The same abbreviated story is also printed in the 1986 Saṃskṛtamuktāvalī of Rameśa Candra.

lg.l: tasyaiva jīvitaṃ ślāghyaṃ yaḥ parārthe hi jīvati ||
bhavādṛśāṃ paropakāriṇām etac citraṃ na bhavati |
kim atra citraṃ ? yat santaḥ parānagrahatatparāḥ |

body.p:
bho mahāsattva ! anenaiva paropakāreṇa tvaṃ sarvāḥ
sampadaḥ prāpnoṣi | yad uktam――

lg.l: sampadaṃ sa samāpnoti paratrā'pi paraṃ padam ||

body.p:
evaṃ bhaṇitvā punaḥ rājānam abravīt— “bho mahāsattva !
tavāhaṃ tuṣṭo 'smi, varaṃ vṛṇīṣva” | rājñoktam— “bho
rākṣasa ! tvaṃ yadi mama prasanno 'si, tarhy adyaprabhṛti
manuṣyabhakṣaṇaṃ parityaja | anyam api mayā abhidhīya
mānam upadeśaṃ śṛṇu |

lg.l: yathātmanaḥ priyāḥ prāṇāḥ sarveṣāṃ prāṇināṃ tathā |
tasmān mṛtyubhayāt te 'pi trātavyāḥ prāṇino budhaiḥ ||

yathā bhavaj jīvitam ātmanaḥ priyaṃ
tathā pareṣām api jīvitaṃ priyam |

nirīkṣyate jīvitam ātmano yathā
tathā pareṣām api rakṣa jīvitam ||”
